Lawsuit: Rhode Island v. Trump
Summary/Description: Democratic state attorneys general sued the Trump administration over its closure of various government agencies including the Institute of Museum and Library Services.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Rhode Island

Lawsuit: Chehab v. Noem
Summary/Description: The cousin of Dr. Rasha Alawieh, a Lebanese citizen and Brown University professor with a H-1B visa, sued the Trump administration over the detention and deportation of Alawieh.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts

Lawsuit: President and Fellows of Harvard College v. US Department of Health and Human Services
Summary/Description: Harvard sued the Trump administration over a $2.26 billion funding freeze, which began after the university refused to comply with the president’s demands.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts

Lawsuit: American Association of University Professors–Harvard Faculty Chapter v. U.S. Department of Justice
Summary/Description: Harvard faculty members sued members of federal antisemitism task force over their decision to freeze federal grants at the university.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts

Lawsuit: Association of American Universities v. Department of Defense
Summary/Description: A group of university associations as well as individual institutions challenged a plan at the Defense Department to cap indirect research cost reimbursements at 15 percent.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts

Lawsuit: Isserdasani v. Noem
Summary/Description: Krish Lal Isserdasani and Hamidreza Khademi, who are international students enrolled in college in the United States on a F-1 visa, sued the Trump administration following the termination of their visas by the Department of Homeland Security.
Original Court: United States District Court for the Western District of Wisconsin

Lawsuit: American Federation of Teachers v. U.S. Department of Education
Summary/Description: AFT sued to block the Education Department’s Feb. 14 directive to colleges to rescind all race-based programming.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Maryland

Lawsuit: Arizona Student Doe #1 v. Trump
Summary/Description: A noncitizen college student in Arizona who is residing in the United States on a F-1 visa, sued the Trump administration following the termination of their visa by the Department of Homeland Security.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Arizona

Lawsuit: Association of American Universities v. The Department of Energy
Summary/Description: Universities and higher ed groups sought to overturn a new Department of Energy policy to cap indirect research costs.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts

Lawsuit: Student Doe 1 v. Noem
Summary/Description: A noncitizen college student enrolled at a college in California who is residing in the United States on a F-1 visa, sued the Trump administration following the termination of their visa by the Department of Homeland Security.
Original Court: United States District Court for the Central District of California

Lawsuit: Association of American Universities v. National Science Foundation
Summary/Description: University associations and various colleges challenged a plan at the National Science Foundation to cap indirect research cost reimbursements at 15 percent.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts

Lawsuit: American Association of University Professors v. United States Department of Justice
Summary/Description: Columbia University faculty sued over the Trump administration’s decision to cut $400 million in grants and contracts to the university.
Original Court: United States District Court for the Southern District of New York

Lawsuit: USA v. Texas
Summary/Description: The Department of Justice argued that a state law that requires in-state tuition be provided to certain eligible undocumented students was unconstitutional under the supremacy clause.
Original Court: United States District Court Northern District of Texas

Lawsuit: Ercelik v. Hyde
Summary/Description: A Turkish citizen enrolled at Hampshire College on an F-1 visa filed a petition for writ of habeas corpus to request that the court ensure that the Department of Homeland Security not detain and deport him before he is able to attend the Eastern Hampshire District Court in person and then depart the United States to return to Turkey.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts

Lawsuit: California v. Department of Education
Summary/Description: The government appealed Judge Joun's temporary restraining order which requires the Department of Education to make available grants that they had attempted to terminate.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts

Lawsuit: University of California Student Association v. McMahon
Summary/Description: A student group challenged the disclosure of student borrowers’ personal and financial information to DOGE officials.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Columbia

Lawsuit: Commonwealth of Massachuetts v. NIH ; Association of American Medical Colleges v. National Institutes of Health ; Association of American Universities v. Department of Health & Human Services
Summary/Description: A coalition of state attorneys general sued the National Institute of Health, the acting NIH Director, HHS, and the acting HHS secretary over the Trump administration's new 14% cap on overhead for federal research grants, alleging that it violates the Administrative Procedures Act. This case was consolidated with similar cases brought by the Association of American Medical Colleges and Association of American Universities.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts

Lawsuit: Commonwealth of Massachusetts v. National Institutes of Health
Summary/Description: Several Democratic-led states challenged the National Institutes of Health’s plan to cut cap reimbursements for indirect research costs.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts

Lawsuit: Association of American Universities v. Department of Health and Human Services
Summary/Description: Universities and higher ed groups sought to overturn the National Institutes of Health’s policy to cap indirect research costs.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts

Lawsuit: Association of American Medical Colleges v. National Institutes of Health
Summary/Description: A group of medical colleges sued the National Institutes of Health over its plan to cap indirect research costs.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts

Lawsuit: Taal v. Trump
Summary/Description: 2 students and a professor at Cornell University sued the Trump administration over the "Protecting the United States from Foreign Terrorists and National Security and Public Safety Threats" and "Additional Measures to Combat Anti Semitism" executive orders that plaintiffs allege interfere with their free speech rights.
Original Court: United States District Court for the Northern District of New York

Lawsuit: American Federation of Teachers v. Bessent
Summary/Description: AFT challenged the Trump administration for granting DOGE access to student borrowers’ personal data.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Maryland

Lawsuit: Harvard College v. U.S. Department of Homeland Security
Summary/Description: Harvard sued to block the Trump administration from revoking its ability to enroll international students as well as a proclamation banning visas for Harvard students.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts

Lawsuit: Oregon Council for the Humanities v. United States DOGE Service
Summary/Description: The Oregon Council for the Humanities sued over grant cuts at the National Endowment for the Humanities.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Oregon

Lawsuit: National Education Association v. U.S. Department of Education
Summary/Description: NEA challenged the Department of Education’s Feb. 14 directive banning race-based programming in K–12 and higher ed.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of New Hampshire

Lawsuit: The Authors Guild v. National Endowment for the Humanities
Summary/Description: A group of NEH grantees sued to challenge grant cuts at the agency, which Trump is trying to shut down.
Original Court: United States District Court for the Southern District of New York

Lawsuit: American Council of Learned Societies v. McDonald
Summary/Description: Academic associations challenged the grant freezes and staffing cuts at the National Endowment for the Humanities.
Original Court: United States District Court for the Southern District of New York

Lawsuit: Chamber of Commerce v. U.S. Department of Homeland Security
Summary/Description: The chamber and Association of American Universities sued the Trump administration over the $100,000 H-1B visa application fee. They argued that the fee is unlawful and would harm American businesses and higher ed.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Columbia

Lawsuit: Global Nurse Force v. Trump
Summary/Description: A variety of associations, higher ed unions and industry groups that depend on international workers challenged the Trump administration’s new policy that requires new H-1B visa applicants to pay a $100,000 fee.
Original Court: United States District Court for the Northern District of California

Lawsuit: Tennessee v. Department of Education
Summary/Description: The State of Tennessee and an admissions advocacy group challenged the definition of a Hispanic-serving institution, arguing that the current eligibility criteria are unconstitutional and discriminatory.
Original Court: United States District Court for the Eastern District of Tennessee

Lawsuit: Commonwealth of Massachusetts v. Kennedy, Jr.
Summary/Description: Sixteen states sued to restart NIH’s grant-review process and restore billions in canceled NIH grants that were related to diversity, equity, inclusion and gender identity.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts

Lawsuit: American Public Health Association v. National Institutes of Health
Summary/Description: Scientists and other groups challenged the National Institutes of Health’s decision to cancel billions in research grants.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts

Lawsuit: State of California v. Department of Education
Summary/Description: Eight states sued to restore canceled grants that supported teacher-training programs.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts

Lawsuit: Council for Opportunity in Education v. U.S. Department of Education
Summary/Description: A college access advocacy group sued the Department of Education for rejecting applications to the Student Support Services grant program. Trump officials say they rejected the grants because they violated aspects of the president’s executive order against DEI. But the advocacy group argues this is unfair and unlawful because when the grant applications were first opened under the Biden administration, they called on applicants to meet the educational needs of “underserved” students, including “students of color.” By retroactively applying these anti-DEI policies, the Trump administration is unfairly penalizing applicants who followed the prompt they were given, the lawsuit argues.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Columbia

Lawsuit: United States v. Beshear
Summary/Description: The Trump administration sued Kentucky Governor Andrew Beshear over a Kentucky regulation which allows undocumented immigrants residing in Kentucky to qualify for reduced tuition at public colleges.
Original Court: United States District Court for the Eastern District of Kentucky

Lawsuit: Thakur v. Trump
Summary/Description: A group of researchers in the University of California system filed this class action lawsuit to challenge grant cuts at various agencies.
Original Court: United States District Court Northern District of California

Lawsuit: American Oversight v. Internal Revenue Service
Summary/Description: American Oversight sued the IRS, Treasury Department, and Education Department, seeking public records related to President Trump's alleged directing of the IRS to revoke Harvard University's 501(c)(3) status.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Columbia

Lawsuit: Khalil v. Joyce
Summary/Description: Mahmoud Khalil, a pro-Palestinian activist at Columbia University, filed a petition for writ of habeas corpus following the revocation of his lawful permanent resident status and detention by ICE.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of New Jersey

Lawsuit: American Association of University Professors v. Rubio
Summary/Description: AAUP and others challenged the Trump administration’s efforts to deport noncitizen students and faculty who have participated in pro-Palestinian protests.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts

Lawsuit: American Federation of Teachers v. U.S. Department of Education
Summary/Description: AFT sued to restore student borrowers’ access to income-driven repayment plans and loan consolidation after the Trump administration shut down all digital applications.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Columbia

Lawsuit: American Association of University Professors v. Trump
Summary/Description: A coalition of labor unions is challenging the Trump administration’s attempt to freeze almost $600 million in federal research grants at UCLA and nearly $17 billion across the UC system as a whole if they do not comply with standards that would allegedly violate the university’s First Amendment rights.
Original Court: United States District Court for the Northern District of California

Lawsuit: Council for Opportunity in Education v. U.S. Department of Education
Summary/Description: A college access advocacy group sued the Department of Education over the cancellation of dozens of TRIO grants that Trump officials say violate the president’s anti-DEI orders. The advocacy group argued that the Trump administration failed to follow the procedural requirements necessary to terminate funding on the basis of a civil rights violation. The cancellations are also an example of executive overreach, they say.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Columbia

Lawsuit: National Council of Nonprofits v. McMahon
Summary/Description: More than a dozen organizations representing an array of cities, labor unions and nonprofit organizations challenged the Trump administration’s recent rule on Public Service Loan Forgiveness. They argue that the final rule violates the First Amendment and illegally allows the Department of Education to silence various employers whose work goes against the president’s political agenda.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts

Lawsuit: Presidents’ Alliance on Higher Education And Immigration v. Pam Bondi
Summary/Description: An immigration and international student advocacy group, along with several anonymous students, challenged the Trump administration’s SEVIS terminations and visa revocations.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts

Lawsuit: American Association of Physics Teachers v. National Science Foundation
Summary/Description: A group of associations challenged the termination of more than $1 billion in previously awarded National Science Foundation grants.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Columbia

Lawsuit: Pueblo of Isleta v. Secretary of the Department of the Interior
Summary/Description: Tribes challenged Trump’s decision to cut staff at two institutions run by the Bureau of Indian Education: Haskell Indian Nations University and Southwestern Indian Polytechnic Institute.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Columbia

Lawsuit: United States v. Newsom
Summary/Description: The Department of Justice sued the state of California, challenging a state law that allows undocumented students to pay in-state tuition rates. The lawsuit also targets the California Dream Act, which offers state financial aid to undocumented students who meet certain requirements.
Original Court: United States District Court for the Eastern District of California

Lawsuit: American Association of University Professors v. United States Department of Justice
Summary/Description: The American Association of University Professors appealed Judge Vyskocil's order dismissing their suit challenging the funding cuts to Columbia University.
Original Court: United States District Court for the Southern District of New York

Lawsuit: Tirrell v. Edelblut
Summary/Description: Parents of transgender athletes challenged a Trump executive order that bans trans girls and women from participating in women’s sports at colleges and public schools. The case originally focused on a New Hampshire law but was amended to include federal regulations.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of New Hampshire

Lawsuit: Doe v. Noem
Summary/Description: A noncitizen college student from China who is residing in the United States on a F-1 visa, sued the Trump administration following the termination of their visa by the Department of Homeland Security.
Original Court: United States District Court for the Western District of Washington

Lawsuit: Chung v. Trump
Summary/Description: Yunseo Chung, a permanent resident of United States, sued the Trump administration over the attempts of Immigration and Customs Enforcement to deport her following her participation in a protest at Columbia University.
Original Court: United States District Court for the Southern District of New York

Lawsuit: National Association of Diversity Officers in Higher Education v. Trump
Summary/Description: A group representing diversity officers in higher ed sued to block President Trump’s anti-DEI executive orders that led to grant terminations, among other consequences.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Maryland

Lawsuit: American Association of Colleges for Teacher Education v. McMahon
Summary/Description: Education colleges and associations representing teachers in training challenged the termination of educator-preparation grants based on their relation to DEI practices.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Maryland

Lawsuit: Morgan v. McMahon
Summary/Description: A student borrower sued the Department of Education for freezing access to income-driven repayment plans.
Original Court: United States District Court for the Western District of Texas

Lawsuit: Department of Education v. California
Summary/Description: The government is requesting the Supreme Court vacate Judge Joun's temporary restraining order which requiring the Department of Education to reinstate grants they had attempted to terminate.
Original Court: Supreme Court of the United States

Lawsuit: Robert F. Kennedy Center for Justice and Human Rights v. McMahon
Summary/Description: Four non-profit public-interest organizations challenged a new rule issued by the Department of Education that threatens to disqualify certain employers and their staff members from eligibility for the federal Public Service Loan Forgiveness program if they participate in illegal activities. The rule states that these activities can include immigration advocacy work and gender affirming care for transgender youth.
Original Court: United States District Court for the District of Columbia
